thread.title: Second Carnival ship in a month emerges from makeover
thread.title_full: Second Carnival ship in a month emerges from makeover

author: Gene Sloan , USA TODAY
title: Second Carnival ship in a month emerges from makeover

organizations.name: usa today fullscreen redfrog pub & brewery
usa today fullscreen ji ji asian kitchen

text:
First look: Inside Carnival Cruise Line's new Carnival Vista
The 133,500-ton Carnival Vista carries a maximum of 4,980 passengers. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Beach Pool is one of three pools and also serves as Carnival Vista’s Seaside Theater. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The area surrounding the Beach Pool is three decks high to allow plenty of space for passengers, both shady and sunny. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Beach Pool is also a popular area because Guy’s Burger Joint is close by. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Guy's Burger Joint features a variety of freshly grilled burgers made a number of ways. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Open most of the day, Guy's Burger Joint is a Carnival passenger favorite. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Carnival Vista’s WaterWorks area features two water slides. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Both slides wind downward to the deck, sending riders in a circular motion. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Power Drencher is a giant bucket of water that fills rather quickly. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Once full, the Power Drencher dumps on anyone below. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen A number of colorful water features. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen WaterWorks is a trademarked feature found on a number of Carnival ships. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Fun for all ages at WaterWorks. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen SkyRide and SkyCourse are two more top-deck features. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen SkyCourse is a ropes course with a variety of features. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen SkyCourse takes a bit of agility to complete. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen SkyCourse takes passengers high above deck - with a safety harness, of course. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen SkyRide is a one-of-a-kind feature that takes riders on a trip high above the deck. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen SkyRide may be closed during periods of high wind. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen SportSquare has a variety of active lifestyle activities. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen SportSquare has a full-size basketball court. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen SportSquare is within view of the ropes course too. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The full-size basketball court at SportSquare. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen There are abundant open deck spaces on the Carnival Vista. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Arranged in multiple areas, there is always a deck chair available. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The aft pool is a popular place at sailaway and features twin whirlpool tubs. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Red Frog Pub & Brewery has an inviting inside entrance. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen RedFrog Pub & Brewery is the result of a unique collaboration between Carnival and Miami-based Concrete Beach Brewery. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Red Frog Pub & Brewery is the first brewery at sea in North America. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen An onboard brewmaster oversees the process of making Carnival’s three diffferent brews. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Brewed here: ThirstyFrog Port Hoppin’ IPA, ThirstyFrog Caribbean Wheat and FriskyFrog Java Stout. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen ThirstyFrog Port Hoppin’ IPA offers aromatic, floral and hoppy notes with passion fruit and citrus overtone. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen In the Atrium of the Carnival Vista, a LED light funnel changes throughout the day. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The lobby area and LED light funnel, seen from two decks above. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The LED light funnel changes with the music being played at the time. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Not far away, another LED light funnel emanates from the casino bar below. This one is enclosed in glass to prevent cigarette smoke from filling the area. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The casino features all the popular games, including Wheel of Fortune. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen One of a number of banks of slot machines in the Carnival Vista casino. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The popular Cherry on Top candy store also has hand-crafted ice cream on the Carnival Vista. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Cherry on Top is one of a number of retail venues that surround the casino’s LED funnel. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Carnival Vista’s Cherry on Top is the largest in the Carnival fleet. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Also in this area is Fahrenheit 555, the ship’s steakhouse. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Across the hall from the steakhouse is the Alchemy Bar. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Not far away is also the quiet Library Bar. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Bonsai Sushi is one of a number of specialty restaurants. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen All around the Carnival Vista, easy-to-read signage points passengers in the right direction. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Cloud 9 Spa suites share a layout similar to other suites on the ship, with a light and airy decor. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Cloud 9 Spa suites feature double-sink bathrooms. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Family Harbor area is for families only. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Family Harbor lounge is a close-by place for families to gather. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Family Harbor lounge also serves breakfast. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Family Harbor-area inside staterooms are roomy. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Family Harbor oceanview staterooms feature big windows. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Family Harbor Cove balconies are large. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Family Harbor quad inside cabins feature bunk beds. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Family Harbor suites invite the entire family to share a cabin in comfort. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Family Harbor suites are roomy. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Family Harbor accommodations feature split bathrooms, one with a bath and the other with a shower. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Family Harbor suites have a shower in one bathroom and a tub in another. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen A convenient mailbox is outside each cabin on the ship. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen A standard balcony cabin has a sofa. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen A standard balcony cabin offers a desk, television and refrigerator too. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Another view of the standard balcony cabin. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabins also have a large mirror above the desk. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Cabins feature USB ports on the desk. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Ocean suites feature a large TV and comfortable sofa. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Ocean suite bathrooms feature a double sink and plenty of storage. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Ocean suite bathrooms feature a full-size tub and shower. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Fast Internet brings a number of advantages on Carnival Vista. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The FunHub offers a variety of online entertainment options. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The digital photo gallery enables passengers to see all their photos in one place. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The FunHub app is a must to download before boarding. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Like the Spa area of the ship, the Havana cabins also have a character of their own. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Havana suites feature light and airy Caribbean-themed decor. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Havana suites open up onto an ocean-facing lanai. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Havana suites may just keep passengers from leaving their cabin - they are that nice. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Havana suite balconies. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Havana suite is a decidedly different stateroom on Carnival Vista. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Havana suite shower is roomy. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Havana suites feature double-sink bathrooms. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Not far from Havana staterooms is the Havana Bar. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Havana Bar features a number of little seating nooks. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Comfortable chairs in the Havana Bar. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Havana Bar has a variety of seating options. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Havana Bar invites guests to linger. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Havana Bar is one of the most thoughtfully decorated spaces on the Carnival Vista. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Havana Bar also has an area that actually looks like a bar. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Havana Bar is host to Cuban music from time to time. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Havana Bar specializes in custom Caribbean-themed rum drinks. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Havana Bar has some of the best music on the ship. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Close to the Havana Bar is the Seafood Shack. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Seafood Shack features a number of fresh fish dishes. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Seafood Shack is also a walk-up dining venue accessible from the aft pool. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Abundant shopping options are available in a number of stores on the Carnival Vista. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Carnival Vista also features a Carnival logo wear shop. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Camp Ocean is one of a variety of youth program opportunities available on the Carnival Vista. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Clubhouse is another youth activity area. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Lido Marketplace is the ship's buffet area. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Lido Marketplace, like many other venues on board, has Caribbean-themed decor. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Also featured in the Lido Marketplace - as well as the Red Frog Pub - are self-serve beer stations. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Something fresh is always being carved in the Lido Marketplace on the Carnival Vista. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen The Serenity adults-only area of the Carnival Vista is the highest public space on the ship. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Ji Ji Asian Kitchen is one of the best dining venues onboard. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Ji Ji is also a culinary lesson in Asian cuisine. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Potstickers are a passenger favorite at Ji Ji Asian Kitchen. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Also featured on the Carnival Vista is the first-ever IMAX Theatre at sea. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Carnival Vista’s IMAX Theatre brings a unique land experience to sea. Chris Owen for USA TODAY Fullscreen Like this topic? (Photo: Andy Newman)
